Cherrycake\UiComponentTable::buildHtml

Builds the HTML of the input. Any setup keys can be given, which will overwrite the ones (if any) given when constructing the object.

    Signature

    public function buildHtml([boolean $setup = false] )

    Parameters

    $setup — boolean
    A hash array with the setup keys
    - style: An additional style name
    - additionalCssClasses: Additional css classes
    - domId: Optional dom Id

    - columns: A hash array for the columns of the table, where the key is a unique column identifier and the value is an array as follows:
    - title: The title of the column
    - style
    - additionalCssClasses
    - data: A hash array for the rows of the table, where each item has a unique key identified and each value is a hash array where each key matched the column's key, and the value is an array as follows:
    - value: The value for the cell

    - items: An Items object to be used to fill the table. If specified, the specified column and data setup keys are discarded.
    - itemFields: A hash array of the field names to be shown on the table when items object is specified, where each key is the field name, and each value an array on which each item overrides the configuration with the same key on the Item object's "fields" property. Refer to Item::fields for a list of available keys
    - itemAdditionalColumns: When specifying items and itemFields, this can be also specified just like the columns key for additional columns to be added to the table. It has the same keys as the columns setup key, plus the following one:
    - valueFunction: A function that returns the value for each row for this column. The item object will be passed as an argument.
    @return string The HTML of the table. Null if no table could be generated.
